snippet: President Clinton is considering making up to 400,000 acres of forests in California a federal monument to protect remaining groves of sequoia trees, administration officials said today.    Mr. Clinton asked Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman to e...
lead_paragraph: President Clinton is considering making up to 400,000 acres of forests in California a federal monument to protect remaining groves of sequoia trees, administration officials said today. Mr. Clinton asked Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman to explore whether the trees ought to be protected under the 1906 Antiquities Act, as he did a month ago to ensure permanent protection over land adjacent to the Grand Canyon.
abstract: Pres Clinton is considering making up to 400,000 acres of forests in California federal monument to protect remaining groves of sequoia trees; asks Agriculture Sec Dan Glickman to explore whether trees ought to be protected under 1906 Antiquities Act (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Move to Protect Sequoias Is Said to Be Considered
